items.sentence: How come you didn't tell me Tom was going to Australia with us?
Tom took a bite from each apple, so no one else would eat them.
Most of us don't walk to school. We either take a bus or drive.
This is a sentence that has the syllable count of a good haiku.
I can't believe that Tom did all of this without anyone's help.
Tom thought the food that Mary had prepared tasted pretty good.
I read the French translation and I thought that it sounded OK.
Never having seen a mongoose, I do not know what they are like.
The sooner you start doing that, the sooner you'll be finished.
People will laugh at you if you do something as stupid as that.
Do you really want to spend the rest of your life in Australia?
If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us.
I think I've found something you might be interested in seeing.
Do you think that Tom has enough money to buy that kind of car?
I still haven't decided whether I should go by car or by train.
Did you really think that I was the one who stole your bicycle?
It takes about thirty minutes to get downtown from the airport.
I had the feeling that Tom knew more about Mary than he let on.
I'm sorry that I wasn't able to attend the yesterday's meeting.
Let me remind you of something that you seem to have forgotten.
